settings.title: Treat your next UTI from your smartphone.
settings.description:
Find out if you have a UTI in 2 minutes. Get same-day antibiotics.
No insurance necessary.

settings.title: Elizabeth, 26
settings.text: I don't get UTIs often, but I can't even begin to describe the horrible pain once it is too late. Scanwell changed my life - the ability to test early and know that I had one before the symptoms really kicked in was a game changer for me.

settings.title: Veronica, 21
settings.text: I have actually never had a UTI before, so I didn't know what to expect. Scanwell was so easy to use and gave me peace of mind that it wasn't in fact a UTI that was causing my symptoms.

settings.title: Leilani, 32
settings.text: Is it me, or do UTIs come at the absolutely worst times? I cycle a lot, so UTIs can become fairly common. Scanwell has made it so easy to just test to see if I have one, and get a prescription when I do.

settings.title: Paige, 22
settings.text: Scanwell might be the best thing to ever happen to me - my 3 day anxiety after sex of waiting, evaluating, seeing if I have symptoms is gone.

settings.title: Tara, 29
settings.text: I have been having UTIs since I was 14. They are so painful, and I can't always get in to see my doctor. Scanwell's doctor feature makes it so easy to get treatment when I need it.

settings.title: Take her word.
settings.description: Hear firsthand from the women who have used Scanwell to treat UTIs.

settings.title: Scanwell Test Kits
settings.raw_content: The test kit is designed for single time use, and has a shelf life of 2 years as long as it is stored in a dry and temperate place. Requires iOS 9 and newer.

settings.title: Same-Day Treatment Options
settings.raw_content:
Currently only available in California, Scanwell doctors are available to review your results, symptoms & medical history (just like they would in-person) and prescribe appropriate antibiotics for same-day pick up at your local pharmacy.

Doctor Consultation Fee: $25

settings.title: Modern delivery of care for less than the average copay.
settings.description: Sitting in the waiting room is a thing of the past - and so is worrying you weren't prescribed the right antibiotics. Scanwell doctors are always available, and can now treat you with the same accuracy and quality care as they would in-person.

settings.title: Test From Anywhere
settings.text: Experiencing UTI symptoms? As soon as something feels, looks, or smells off — it’s time to test.

settings.title: Get Results In 2 Minutes
settings.text: Take a picture of your test strip using the Scanwell app. Find out if you have a UTI in 2 minutes.

settings.title: Begin A Consultation
settings.text: During your consultation our doctors will review your test and symptoms, and prescribe treatment.

settings.title: Get Antibiotics
settings.text: Need antibiotics? Our doctors can send a same-day prescription to your local pharmacy.

settings.title: We’re not ANTI-antibiotics, we just understand the risks associated with the misdiagnosis of a UTI, and overprescription of antibiotics when not necessary.
In short, it's not good.
settings.text: Think about antibiotic use like a cat with nine lives. There are only a limited number of times we can use a particular antibiotic to fight off a strain of bacteria before the bacteria is able to adapt to the drug and become resistant to it. When this happens, the once-effective antibiotic becomes powerless against future diseases caused by this bacteria.

settings.description:
We outlined our particular concerns in a white-paper co-authored with Inova Medical Group about how repeated antimicrobial use (aka antibiotics) can accelerate the emergence of drug-resistant pathogens, and the need for more standardized and appropriate use of diagnostic methods in the accountability of a treatment decision.

A few key takeaways:

settings.title: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared antimicrobial resistance a global public health threat in 2014.
settings.description:
Stating that common infections such as pneumonia, tuberculosis, gonorrhea and food-borne diseases were becoming increasingly difficult to treat. 

In particular, they noted that there was already high resistance to fluoroquinolones (a family of antibiotics) for the treatment of UTIs. While in a 2018 statement, they reported between 8% to 65% of E. coli associated with UTIs presented resistance to ciprofloxacin (another type of antibiotic) globally.

When antibiotic treatment options are limited, physicians are forced to prescribe more toxic and more expensive antibiotics to the patient. Patients with resistant infections require significantly longer hospital stays, incur higher medical costs, and have a higher risk of long term disability.

With the rapid spread of drug-resistant pathogens and the decreasing availability of new antibiotics - the WHO warns that,

Due to the acute onset of UTI symptoms, patients are often driven to seek care from non-traditional care settings (urgent care, emergency departments, telehealth services) where antibiotic overuse is widespread.

This is because decision making processes vary widely among the different care settings, and additional tests for differential diagnosis are often excluded.

settings.title: Many studies show that using symptoms alone to diagnose UTI (with no further testing) is only accurate 50% of the time.
settings.text:
We believe leveraging proven diagnostic methods to improve UTI management decisions is fundamental to combating these trends.

We created the first FDA approved over-the-counter at-home urinalysis test for the following reasons:

- Urinalysis for leukocytes and nitrites is a convenient first practice for detection of UTI due to its cost effectiveness and quick turnaround time. Primary care settings often use a dipstick to aid in diagnosis of UTI. 

- Until now, however, there hasn't been a reliable way for physicians to prescribe based on a patients' at-home test. By using our proprietary calibration card and computer vision to analyze the test, we turn what has historically been a "subjective" test into an "objective" one - enabling physicians to reliably use the results of our test.

settings.title: That's why we created Scanwell.
settings.description: We knew that creating a standardized and accessible diagnostic method would create more accountability to empower you; because it's not just about how you feel today, it's also about your well-being long term.

settings.title: Order your test kit today
settings.text: Keeping at least one Scanwell test kit on-hand can help you receive a diagnosis, begin treatment, and relieve symptoms faster.

settings.title: Help us decide where to expand quickest, and get notified of plans for your area
Same-day treatment is currently available in CA, but is headed your way.

settings.text: By signing up, you agree to receive periodic emails from Scanwell Health — you may opt-out at any time.

settings.title: Team Member
settings.text: Use this text to describe your team member, share details on their background, and describe their contributions.

settings.title: Timeline episode

settings.title: Timeline episode
settings.story: This tab content type will accept rich text to help with adding styles and links to additional pages or content. Use this to add supplementary information to help your buyers.

settings.title: Our doctors take into account the whole picture of your health.
settings.text:
When you submit a consultation with in the Scanwell app, our doctors will review your medical history, symptoms, and test results.

This approach ensures treatment that's as accurate as you'd receive in-person, and that you only take antibiotics when you really need them.

settings.title: The Scanwell app identifies a UTI using colorimetric analysis.
settings.text:
The Scanwell app and UTI Self Test Kit work together to identify a UTI in just 2 minutes.

When the test strip comes in contact with your urine, a color change occurs. The app uses your phone’s camera to analyze the color change, providing clinical-grade urinalysis from your smartphone.

settings.title: Our test strips are the same as those used in urgent care, emergency rooms, and hospitals.
settings.text:
They detect the two key indicators of a UTI: leukocytes and nitrites.

Leukocytes are white blood cells; they aren't usually found in urine, so if they're present in yours, that's a good indicator that your body is fighting off an infection.

Nitrites are a product of Gram-negative bacteria (including E. coli, which causes the majority of UTIs). Nitrites in your urine indicate that bacteria are present.

settings.title: Without a urine test, 50% of suspected UTI cases go misdiagnosed.
settings.text:
Scanwell is the first UTI testing app cleared by the FDA.

A clinical study showed the Scanwell test gets the same results as the urine test a doctor would perform.

settings.title: The first FDA cleared urine testing app for safely diagnosing and treating UTIs from the comfort of your home.
UTI Screening & Treatment made safe & simple
Understanding your results
settings.text:
Our technology, which detects the presence of leukocytes & nitrites, was carefully designed to enable your iOS device to read your test kit with the same accuracy as your doctor's office. 

Test results are provided directly to you in the Scanwell app that highlight the UTI indicators present in your urine and includes additional information to help inform clinical decision making from our medical team.

Everything in the test report is supported by up-to-date clinical findings and scientific research. 

You may get inaccurate results if: 

- You are dehydrated (the results may indicate that Leukocytes are not present when they are actually present).

- You have been taking medicine or dietary supplements that may change urine color *such as drugs containing AZO dyes (i.e. Pyridium, Gantrisin or Gantanol)

- You have a UTI caused by bacteria that does not change nitrate to nitrite, or if your diet does not include nitrates

- When urine has not been held in the bladder for more than 4 hours

- You have high amounts of albumin, bilirubin, calcium chloride, citric acid, glucose, and.or oxalic acid in your urine (results may indicate that leukocytes are not present when they are actually present)

Your test kit syncs with your app, where it is screened for two most common indicators of a UTI - those responsible for about 85% of

settings.title: Put your UTI to the test.
settings.story:
Symptoms only paint part of the picture. Learn more about why testing your urine matters. 

Final price depending on treatment + $25 doctor consultation fee
